p: Vitamin A is one of the fat-soluble vitamins. The name refers to polyene compounds comprising a beta-ionone ring and a polyene side chain containing a functional group: an alcohol group, retinol; an aldehyde group, retinal; an acid group, retinoic acid; or an ester group, retinyl ester. Derivatives of vitamin A, called retinoids, include both natural and many synthetic retinol derivatives with activity similar to that of vitamin A [ 27, 28, 29, 30, 31] ( Figure 2).
